para.text: There is established as a special fund the Neighborhood Safety and Engagement Fund ("Fund"), which shall be administered by the Mayor in accordance with subsections (c) and (d) of this section.
Revenue from the following sources shall be deposited in the Fund:
Donations from public and private entities.
Money in the Fund shall be used to fund the activities of the ONSE, including:
Providing financial incentives to eligible participants, which may be issued by ONSE or an agency designated by the Mayor;
Providing grants to eligible community organizations; and
Appropriate overhead or administrative expenses related to the ONSE and the Fund.

para.codify:annotation: Section 7014 of D.C. Law 22-33 repealed § 901 of D.C. Law 21-125. Therefore the changes made to this section by D.C. Law 21-125 have been given effect.

para.text: The money deposited into the Fund, and interest earned, shall not revert to the unrestricted fund balance of the General Fund of the District of Columbia at the end of a fiscal year, or at any other time.
Subject to authorization in an approved budget and financial plan, any funds appropriated in the Fund shall be continually available without regard to fiscal year limitation.
